question: Being a non-member who among the following can participate in the proceedings of either House of Parliament without having the voting right?
explanation: The Attorney General for India is the Indian government\'s chief legal advisor and is primary lawyer in the Supreme Court of India. He has the right to speak and to take part in the proceedings of both the Houses of Parliament and their joint sittings and in any committee of the Parliament of which he may be named a member, but without the right to vote.
